timeAnchors.definition: The initiation of ABBV-951 (study drug) administration
timeAnchors.sourceText: The Treatment Period starts with the initiation of ABBV-951... On the morning of Day 1 (V3) subjects will need to be in a clinically defined "Off" state (i.e., no PD medications for at least 12 hours before initiation of study drug).

repetitions.sourceText: following CSCI for 28 days with a fixed indwelling catheter at a rate of 0.1 or 0.25 mL/hour
ABBV-951 was administered as a loading dose followed by a continuous infusion for up to 72 hours
infusion of ABBV-951 at the same concentration (50/200 mg/mL), but at a higher infusion rate (0.5 mL/hour) for fewer days (5 days) was well tolerated

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'If subject experiences AE requiring discontinuation', 'path': ['EARLY_TERMINATION', 'FOLLOW_UP']}, {'condition': 'In countries where PKG watch is not approved', 'path': ['REDUCED_MONITORING_PERIOD']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Assessment of eligibility is performed once at the start of the study to determine subject participation.
The protocol describes a loading dose administered as a one-time event followed by a continuous infusion.
ABBV-951 is delivered via continuous infusion over a period of time (e.g., up to 72 hours in Phase 1) to maintain steady levodopa exposure.
Infusion rates are adjusted based on individual patient needs and motor symptom control, involving decision points for alternative rates or extra doses.
Tolerability and infusion site findings are monitored repeatedly throughout the treatment period to assess safety.

footnoteConditions.text: a. The Screening Period may be extended up to a total of 90 days for extenuating circumstances.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a. The Screening Period may be extended up to a total of 90 days for extenuating circumstances.

footnoteConditions.text: b. The Monitoring Period can occur any time before V3, as long as it lasts for 6 consecutive days.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: b. The Monitoring Period can occur any time before V3, as long as it lasts for 6 consecutive days.

footnoteConditions.text: c. GFR will be calculated one time at Screening Visit 1 (V1) according to the Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) equation.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: c. GFR will be calculated one time at Screening Visit 1 (V1) according to the Chronic Kidney Disease

footnoteConditions.text: d. Special laboratory tests to detect vitamin deficiencies will be performed at Screening Visit 1, Day 1, Week 6, Week 26, and Week 52.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: d. Special laboratory tests to detect vitamin deficiencies will be performed at Screening Visit 1, D

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Adverse Event Incidence

timeWindow.reference: First infusion to end of study

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Count of subjects with >= 1 AE / Total subjects in Safety Analysis Set) * 100
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Descriptive summary of safety and tolerability
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Percentage of subjects with adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) during the study

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Infusion Site Evaluation Scale
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Count of subjects with Numeric Grade >= 5 OR Letter Grade >= 'D' at any time
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Percentage of subjects meeting threshold criteria
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Percentage of subjects with numeric grade equal to or higher than 5 and percentage of subjects with letter grade equal to or higher than D on the Infusion Site Evaluation Scale at any time during the

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Change in Safety Parameters
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: End of Study Value - Baseline Value
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Change in clinical laboratory test data from Baseline to end of study

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Normalized Daily Off/On Time
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Average normalized daily time at End of Study - Average normalized daily time at Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Paired-sample t-test for change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Average normalized daily 'Off' time and 'On' times as assessed by the PD Diary

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: PD Symptoms (MDS-UPDRS)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Total Score at End of Study - Total Score at Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Paired-sample t-test for change from Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: PD symptoms as assessed by the Movement Disorder Society-Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (MDS-UPDRS) Parts I-IV

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Quality of Life (PDQ-39)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: PDQ-39 score at End of Study - PDQ-39 score at Baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Quality of life as assessed by the PD Questionnaire-39 items (PDQ-39)

derivedVariables.name: Percentage of subjects with AESIs
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Number of subjects with at least one AESI / Total number of subjects) * 100
